detailPageContent.title: Oath
detailPageContent.paragraph: In the time before forgetting, when stories were carved into hearthstones and roles passed like rings through bloodlines, we rose. Not to break, but to retell. Not to erase, but to reveal. Ours is an oath to unbind the old tales — to lift the veils from what family and society were told to be. Through tale and image, we summon what was buried and let it speak. This is our banner. This is our binding.

detailPageContent.title: Realm
detailPageContent.paragraph: We see a world not yet written, though its name echoes in the bones of the old songs. A realm where roles are not cast in stone but chosen like blades — with care, with meaning, and with fire. In this place, every voice has a banner. Every face is named. We do not conquer it; we remember it. And in remembering, we summon it forth.

detailPageContent.title: Pillars
detailPageContent.paragraph: These are the four that must stand, if the vision is to rise.

rows: Secure the tools of creation: funding, craft, and the spark. Let two works be brought forth — to speak, to stand, to begin.
Call the artists to the fire. Build the fellowship. Let a residency arise — small in number, great in voice.
Design the stronghold that shall house the vision. Mark its needs, trace its plan, and seek the land where it will stand.
Summon rivers of support: merchandise, gatherings, word-born offerings. Let not the house rely only on tribute — but earn its own crown.

detailPageContent.title: Path
detailPageContent.paragraph: To reach the Realm, one must walk with foresight. These are the movements — deliberate, battle-tested, and bound to oath.

rows: Create works that echo the mission
To show the realm-to-come before it rises — so all may see and be stirred.
To give name and form to those cast in shadow. No voice shall go unclaimed.
Not all truth wears old robes. The path demands new forms of telling and seeing.
Train artists in craft and courage
The work must endure. Let hands be steady, minds be clear, voices be bold.
Build a living circle of creators
Not a court, but a fellowship. Strength lies in the bond between banner-bearers.
The Realm needs a hearth — shaped in plan, rooted in place, open to all.
Let the people be called. Let art become firelight. Let story become rallying cry.
Bring the work to learning halls
What we tell must be seeded in the next generation’s soil. Legacy is the long game.
Let no border halt our voice. The web is a field of many banners.
So that the work may be guarded and seen by lords and common folk alike.
Gather a board of wise advisors
No house rises alone. Wisdom must walk alongside vision.
The Realm must feed itself. Glory fades without grain.
Craft a brand and public voice
So all who see it will know: this banner stands for something worth following.
The path changes. The oath does not. Let our steps adapt without forgetting.

detailPageContent.title: Structure
detailPageContent.paragraph: The Realm does not rise on vision alone. It stands on law, lineage, and loyal design.
listItems: The mission must bind all who serve — oath before outcome.
We ride beneath banners that grant us right to seek aid — the grants and gifts of the realm.
Gold flows best when it is honored — and those who give may give more with open parchment and clear ledgers.
The House must be seen and trusted — its walls transparent, its halls accountable.
No gain is hoarded. Every coin returns to the fire that lit us.
A great hall is not empty — the people are its strength, and we call them in.

detailPageContent.title: Call
detailPageContent.paragraph:
I cannot name the moment you took root in me. Whether by chance, by fate, or by some enchantment of the heart — I only know that since then, you have moved something within me. Not with declarations, but with the quiet weight of who you are.

There are things in you that speak to the deepest banners I still carry — ideals I forgot I lived by, dreams I did not know still burned.

And though I cannot say why, not in the language of reason, I know this: in our crossing fourteen moons ago, in a land across the big sea, something was awakened. And now, I move not from logic, but from oath.

detailPageContent.title: Flame
detailPageContent.paragraph:
There were three signs: a tale of the wrong Miriam, a verse from Makkot, and the Song of Serach. I did not know what they meant — only that they echoed. One shimmered with brilliance, one weighed with silence, one cracked open a breath I hadn’t taken in years.

And then, mid-run, with wind at my back and pulse like a war drum, the words came — not summoned, but revealed: “We are missing a Sansa Foundation.”

Not a thought. A flame. And in that flame, I saw the work, the name, the reason — all waiting, all known, all already burning.
